title: Classical Political Economy: Ricardo to Bastiat
description: The classical economics tradition from Smith's successors: Ricardo's comparative advantage and labor theory, Say's Law, Mill's synthesis, and Bastiat's harmony of interests. Foundation for both free market economics and later critiques.
keyTheories: Ricardo: Comparative advantage, labor theory of value, Ricardian rent
Mill: Synthesis of classical economics, last great classical work
Bastiat: Harmony of interests, brilliant free trade advocacy
researchValue: Documents the mature classical economics tradition before the marginalist revolution. Essential for understanding 19th century political economy and debates over free trade vs protectionism.
